Description: Fragment of rim and bowl of pottery plate, with ledge rim. On underside, seven bands; on top of rim maeander hooks; on floor, part of animal with triangle fill, standing on maeander hook band; small exergue with dots; three bands around periphery of floor.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (Nau 30, pl. 7e-f)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.671)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4691 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
